oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Successful implementation of a wellness and tobacco cessation curriculum in psychosocial rehabilitation clubhouses
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Tobacco remains a seemingly intractable problem for individuals living with severe and persistent mental illness. This study evaluated the implementation, technical assistance, and perceived impact of a model curriculum ("Learning About Healthy Living") to promote wellness and motivation to quit tobacco use in psychosocial rehabilitation clubhouses.
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: Lee et al.; licensee BioMed Central Ltd.
